translations.1: Wa-taraknaa ba'dahum Yawma'izien yamooju fee ba'dinw Wa-nufikha fis Soori fajama'naahum jam'aa
translations.15: On that Day, We will let them surge ˹like waves˺ over one another. Later, the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather all ˹people˺ together

words.translation: And We (will) present|Hell|(on) that Day|to the disbelievers|(on) display

translations.1: Wa-'aradnaa jahannama Yawma'izil lilkaafireena 'ardaa
translations.15: On that Day We will display Hell clearly for the disbelievers

words.translation: Those|had been|their eyes|within|a cover|from|My remembrance|and were|not|able|(to) hear

translations.1: Allazeena kaanat a'yunuhum fee ghitaaa'in 'an zikree Wa-kaanoo la yastatee'oona sam'aa
translations.15: those who turned a blind eye to My Reminder and could not stand listening ˹to it˺

words.translation: Do then think|those who|disbelieve|that|they (can) take|My servants|besides Me|besides Me|(as) protectors|Indeed, We|We have prepared|Hell|for the disbelievers|(as) a lodging

translations.1: Afahasibal lazeena kafarooo aien yattakhizoo 'ibaadee min dooneee awliyaaa'; innaaa a'tadnaa jahannama lil-kaafireena nuzulaa
translations.15: Do the disbelievers think they can ˹simply˺ take My servants as lords instead of Me? We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers

words.translation: Say|Shall|We inform you|of the greatest losers|(as to their) deeds

translations.1: Qul hal nunabbi'ukum bilakhsareena a'maalaa
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Shall we inform you of who will lose the most deeds

words.translation: Those|is lost|their effort|in|the life|(of) the world|while they|think|that they|(were) acquiring good|(in) work

translations.1: Allazeena dalla sa'yuhum fil hayaatid dunyaa Wa-hum yahsaboona annahum yuhsinoona sun'aa
translations.15: ˹They are˺ those whose efforts are in vain in this worldly life, while they think they are doing good!”

words.translation: Those|(are) the ones who|disbelieve|in the Verses|(of) their Lord|and the meeting (with) Him|So (are) vain|their deeds|so not|We will assign|for them|(on) the Day|(of) the Resurrection|any weight

translations.1: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena kafaroo bi-aayaati Rabbihim Wa-liqaaa'ihee fahabitat a'maaluhum falaa nuqeemu lahum Yawmal Qiyaamati waznaa
translations.15: It is they who reject the signs of their Lord and their meeting with Him, rendering their deeds void, so We will not give their deeds any weight on Judgment Day

words.translation: That|(is) their recompense|Hell|because|they disbelieved|and took|My Verses|and My Messengers|(in) ridicule

translations.1: Zaalika jazaaa'uhum jahannamu bimaa kafaroo wattakhazooo Aayaatee Wa-Rusulee huzuwaa
translations.15: That is their reward: Hell, for their disbelief and mockery of My signs and messengers

words.translation: Indeed|those who|believed|and did|righteous deeds|for them will be|for them will be|Gardens|(of) the Paradise|(as) a lodging

translations.1: Innal lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati kaanat lahum Jannaatul Firdawsi nuzulaa
translations.15: Indeed, those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Paradise as an accommodation

words.translation: Abiding forever|in it|Not|they will desire|from it|any transfer

translations.1: Khaalideena feeha la yabghoona 'anhaa hiwalaa
translations.15: where they will be forever, never desiring anywhere else

words.translation: Say|If|were|the sea|ink|for (the) Words|(of) my Lord|surely (would be) exhausted|the sea|before|[that]|(were) exhausted|(the) Words|(of) my Lord|even if|We brought|(the) like (of) it|(as) a supplement

translations.1: Qul law kaanal bahru midaadal li-kalimaati Rabbee lanafidal bahru qabla an tanfada Kalimaatu Rabbee Wa-law ji'naa bimislihee madadaa
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ocean were ink for ˹writing˺ the Words of my Lord, it would certainly run out before the Words of my Lord were finished, even if We refilled it with its equal.”

words.translation: Say|Only|I|(am) a man|like you|Has been revealed|to me|that|your God|(is) God|One|So whoever|is|hoping|(for the) meeting|(with) his Lord|let him do|deeds|righteous|and not|associate|in (the) worship|(of) his Lord|anyone

translations.1: Qul innamaaa ana basharum mislukum yoohaaa ilaiya annamaa ilaahukum Ilaahunw Waahid; faman kaana yarjoo liqaaa'a Rabbihee falya'mal 'amalan saalihanw Wa-laa yushrik bi'ibaadati Rabbiheee ahadaa
translations.15: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a man like you, ˹but˺ it has been revealed to me that your God is only One God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with their Lord, let them do good deeds and associate none in the worship of their Lord.”
